key_responsibilities: assisting the District Office staff with additional tasks
assisting constituents of the 38th Congressional District resolve problems with federal agencies or find the appropriate state or local contact for non-federal issues
requirements: ability to prioritize in a fast-paced environment
work cooperatively and courteously with others
temperament to communicate with a variety of personalities in a tactful, pleasant, and professional manner
knowledge of California state and federal government agencies
good computer skills, including proficiency and experience with Microsoft Word, Excel, Outlook, Publisher and Power Point
strong communication, analytical, and organization skills
ability to relate well with individuals of diverse backgrounds
thorough understanding of government agencies and structure (county, state, and federal)
ability to work efficiently and effectively as a member of a team
bachelor’s degree from an accredited four-year college or university
salary: will depend on the experience of the applicant

key_responsibilities: transporting the member on a daily basis
staffing the member at various events
requirements: comfortable working in a fast paced environment
able to adjust to sudden schedule changes
previous Capitol Hill experience is strongly desired

key_responsibilities: generating ideas that yield media coverage
promoting the Member’s agenda through traditional and social media
serving as primary spokesperson for national and local media
managing coverage of legislative action and events
drafting statements, releases, speeches, opinion editorials and responses to articles
requirements: extensive media contacts and background working with both print and electronic media
excellent oral and written communications skills
ability to work in a high pressure, team-oriented environment while juggling multiple tasks
significant Appropriations and Capitol Hill experience
knowledge on Homeland and DOD issues are a bonus

office: Energy and Commerce Committee Democratic Staff
key_responsibilities: preparation for committee hearings, markups, meetings and events
maintaining files, office supplies and equipment
assisting staff with research, work product, web content, special projects
requirements: excellent written and oral communication skills

key_responsibilities: manage all aspects of constituent correspondence
processing incoming correspondence through Intranet Quorum (IQ)
meeting with constituents on policy matters

location: personal office and on Committee staff
key_responsibilities: write floor speeches and committee statements
handle meetings with constituents and interest groups on behalf of Member
generating ideas that yield media coverage
promoting the Member’s agenda through traditional and social media
serving as primary spokesperson for national and local media
managing coverage of legislative action and events
drafting statements, releases, speeches, opinion editorials and responses to articles
requirements: extensive media contacts and background working with both print and electronic media
excellent oral and written communications skills
ability to work in a high pressure, team-oriented environment while juggling multiple tasks

key_responsibilities: directly staffing the Congressman on the Appropriations Committee for defense, veterans, and foreign affairs policy issues
several other policy areas would be included in legislative portfolio for this position

office: Majority staff of the House Committee on Homeland Security
key_responsibilities: advising the Chairman and Subcommittee staff
being the point person for all Committee Members on these subject areas
requirements: well versed in border security and immigration law
current or previous Hill experience are strongly preferred
good relationships with relevant Hill and Administration points of contact

office: Democratic Member of the House Energy & Commerce Committee
key_responsibilities: advising the Member on all matters in the issue portfolio
drafting vote recommendations and talking points for related floor and committee proceedings
staffing the Member in relevant meetings
representing the Member before constituents and stakeholders
requirements: previous work expertise on these issues
prior legislative experience advising a Member of Congress and advancing policy proposals
excellent written and verbal communication skills
eagerness to work in a fast-paced, collaborative office

key_responsibilities: assisting in any other aspects of the team’s fast-paced media operation
requirements: expertise in and a passion for digital media and politics
Hill experience and Florida ties are a plus

key_responsibilities: efficient and accurate management of all aspects of the member’s daily and long-term schedule
contributing to other miscellaneous projects as needed
helping constituents with their visits to Washington, DC
requirements: ability to work independently with sound judgment and minimal direction
ability to work cooperatively and courteously with others
two years of experience in an administrative or scheduling role preferred
